com.jack.dicewars.dice_wars.game.board

Class AbstractBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jack.dicewars.dice_wars.game.board.AbstractBoard
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GridTextBoard

    public abstract class AbstractBoard
extends java.lang.Object
    A board defines connections between Territories, it has different constraints based on its size, amount of Players, and other factors in Configuration. It has many initial states for each set of constraints.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.util.List<TerritoryBorder> board
      A well ordered list of TerritoryBorders, which also define well ordered connections between themselves.

      static int BOARD_SIZE_SMALL 
      protected Configuration config 
      protected static int DICE_PER_PLAYER
      Number of dice each Player at the start of the game in addition to their 1 per Territory.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AbstractBoard(Game game, Configuration config)
      Saves the configuration used for making this game because it is important for balancing the number of Players that start with Territories.

      • config

        protected Configuration config

      • board

        protected java.util.List<TerritoryBorder> board
        A well ordered list of TerritoryBorders, which also define well ordered connections between themselves. The specific order is determined by the subclass implementation.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractBoard

        public AbstractBoard(Game game,
                     Configuration config)
        Saves the configuration used for making this game because it is important for balancing the number of Players that start with Territories.
        Parameters:
        game - the game this board is contained in.
        config - the configuration which defines constraints for the start states of this board.

    • Method Detail

      • startState

        public void startState()
        Puts the board in an appropriate state to start the game. Assigns Players some Territories, and values to those Territories. Amount of territories that are assigned are based on the amount of players and the value of Configuration.colorlessTerritory.

      • generateLayout

        protected abstract java.util.List<TerritoryBorder> generateLayout()
        Returns:
        A well ordered list of TerritoryBorders.

      • generateGridConnections

        protected abstract java.util.List<TerritoryBorder> generateGridConnections()
        This helper method finishes the instantiation of the TerritoryBorders in this Board by connecting to TerritoryBorder.neighbors in a way defined by the subclass' implementation.
        Returns:
        The updated List of TerritoryBorders, which now have data on their neighbors in a well defined structure.

      • assignFairly

        protected java.util.List<TerritoryBorder> assignFairly()
        Attempts to distribute territories to all available Players fairly and gives all Players an equal number of dice to begin the game. Some territories will be assigned to .NullPlayer if and only if Configuration.colorlessTerritory is true for this Board's config.
        Returns:
        A list of TerritoryBorders where all Players control an approximately equal number of Territories and an equal number of dice.

      • assignTerritories

        protected abstract void assignTerritories()
        Assigns Territories to Players by linking the internal Territory to a Color and registering the Territory with the Player (for caching). Each player is giving exactly the same amount of Territories (when possible). Leftovers after distributing evenly are given to random players, unless colorless territories is enabled in the config.

      • assignDice

        protected abstract void assignDice()
        Randomly assigns a preset number of dice based on DICE_PER_PLAYER. Each owned territory is guaranteed to have at least 1 die.

      • requestSelection

        public void requestSelection(TerritoryBorder territory)
        Parameters:
        territory - The territory requesting to be selected based on the click of it's TerritoryView

      • getBoard

        public java.util.List<TerritoryBorder> getBoard()
        A list of the existing borders (one for each Territory).
        Returns:
        The list of TerritoryBorder objects in an order defined by a subclass implementation.

      • passesFilter

        public boolean passesFilter(Filterable territory,
                            java.util.HashSet<Filter> filters)
        Checks territory for the criteria defined in Map. Possible types criteria and the form of their value is defined by TODO define this thing.
        Parameters:
        territory - The territory being checked by filters
        filters - The criteria to check the territory by
        Returns:
        Whether the territory meets the criteria in filters.

      • getPrimaryActionId

        public int getPrimaryActionId()
        Returns:
        The string resource id for what the current action's text should be for the game's primary button.
